==Events==
*[[1229]] &ndash; The [[Sixth Crusade]]: [[Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor]] signs a ten-year [[truce]] with [[al-Kamil]], regaining [[Jerusalem]], [[Nazareth]], and [[Bethlehem]] with neither military engagements nor support from the [[papacy]].
*[[1268]] &ndash; The [[Livonian Brothers of the Sword]] are defeated by [[Daumantas of Pskov|Dovmont]] of [[Pskov]] in the [[Battle of Wesenberg (1268)|Battle of Rakvere]].
*[[1332]] &ndash; [[Amda Seyon I of Ethiopia|Amda Seyon I]], [[Emperor of Ethiopia]] begins his campaigns in the southern [[Muslim]] provinces.
*[[1478]] &ndash; [[George Plantagenet, 1st Duke of Clarence|George, Duke of Clarence]], convicted of [[treason]] against his older brother [[Edward IV of England]], is [[execution (legal)|executed]] in private at the [[Tower of London]].
*[[1637]] &ndash; [[Eighty Years' War]]: Off the coast of [[Cornwall]], England, a [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] fleet [[Battle off Lizard Point|intercepts]] an important [[Kingdom of England|Anglo]]-[[Dutch Republic|Dutch]] merchant convoy of 44 vessels escorted by 6 warships, destroying or capturing 20 of them.
*[[1745]] &ndash; The city of [[Surakarta]], [[Central Java]] is founded on the banks of [[Solo River, Java|Bengawan Solo River]], and becomes the capital of the Kingdom of Surakarta.
*[[1766]] – A mutiny by captive [[Malagasy people|Malagasy]] begins at sea on the slave ship ''[[Meermin slave mutiny|''Meermin'']]'', leading to the ship's destruction on [[Cape Agulhas]] in present-day South Africa and the recapture of the instigators.
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[Fourth Anglo-Dutch War]]: Captain [[Thomas Shirley (Royal Navy officer)|Thomas Shirley]] [[Shirley's Gold Coast expedition|opens his expedition]] against [[Dutch Gold Coast|Dutch colonial outposts]] on the Gold Coast of Africa (present-day [[Ghana]]).
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[French Revolutionary Wars]]: Sir [[Ralph Abercromby]] and a fleet of 18 [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] warships [[Invasion of Trinidad (1797)|invade]] [[Trinidad]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Montereau]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; In [[Montgomery, Alabama]], [[Jefferson Davis]] is inaugurated as the provisional President of the [[Confederate States of America]].
*  1861   &ndash; With [[Italian unification]] almost complete, [[Victor Emmanuel II of Italy|Victor Emmanuel II]] of [[Piedmont]], [[Savoy]] and [[Sardinia]] assumes the title of [[King of Italy]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Union Army|Union]] forces under [[Major General]] [[William T. Sherman]] set the [[South Carolina State House]] on fire during the [[Columbia, South Carolina, in the Civil War|burning of Columbia]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]]n revolutionary leader [[Vasil Levski]] is executed by [[hanging]] in [[Sofia]] by the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] authorities.
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[John Tunstall]] is [[murder]]ed by [[outlaw]] [[Jesse Evans (outlaw)|Jesse Evans]], sparking the [[Lincoln County War]] in [[Lincoln County, New Mexico]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn]] by [[Mark Twain]] is published in the United States.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: Imperial forces suffer their worst single-day loss of life on [[Bloody Sunday (1900)|Bloody Sunday]], the first day of the [[Battle of Paardeberg]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Edouard de Laveleye]] forms the [[Belgian Olympic Committee]] in [[Brussels]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; The first official flight with [[air mail]] takes place from [[Allahabad]], [[United Provinces of Agra and Oudh|United Provinces]], [[British India]] (now India), when [[Henri Pequet]], a 23-year-old pilot, delivers 6,500 letters to [[Naini]], about {{Convert|10|km|mi}} away.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Pedro Lascuráin]] becomes [[President of Mexico]] for 45 minutes; this is the shortest term to date of any person as president of any country.
*[[1930]] &ndash; While studying photographs taken in [[January]], [[Clyde Tombaugh]] discovers [[Pluto]].
*  1930   &ndash; [[Elm Farm Ollie]] becomes the first [[cattle|cow]] to fly in a [[fixed-wing aircraft]] and also the first cow to be milked in an aircraft.
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[Empire of Japan]] declares [[Manzhouguo]] (the obsolete Chinese name for [[Manchuria]]) independent from the [[Republic of China]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; During the [[Nanking Massacre]] tha Nanking Safety Zone International Committee is renamed "Nanking International Rescue Committee" and the safety zone in place for refugees falls apart.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Imperial Japanese Army]] begins the [[Sook Ching massacre|systematic extermination]] of perceived hostile elements among the [[Chinese in Singapore]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; The [[Nazism|Nazis]] arrest the members of the [[White Rose]] movement.
*  1943   &ndash; [[Joseph Goebbels]] delivers his [[Sportpalast speech|''Sportpalast'' speech]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; Sailors of the [[Royal Indian Navy]] [[Royal Indian Navy Mutiny|mutiny]] in [[Mumbai|Bombay]] harbour, from where the action spreads throughout the [[Presidencies and provinces of British India|Provinces of British India]], involving 78 ships, twenty shore establishments and 20,000 sailors
*[[1954]] &ndash; The first [[Church of Scientology]] is established in [[Los Angeles, California]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Operation Teapot]]: Teapot test shot "Wasp" is successfully detonated at the [[Nevada Test Site]] with a yield of [[Effects of nuclear explosions#Summary of the effects|1.2 kilotons]].  Wasp is the first of fourteen shots in the Teapot series.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Kenya]]n rebel leader [[Dedan Kimathi]] is executed by the British colonial government.
*  1957   &ndash; [[Walter James Bolton]] becomes the last person [[Capital punishment in New Zealand|legally executed]] in New Zealand.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[The Gambia]] becomes independent from the United Kingdom.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Hawthorne Nevada Airlines Flight 708]] crashes into [[Mount Whitney]] killing all on board.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Chicago Seven]] are found not guilty of conspiring to incite [[riot]]s at the [[1968 Democratic National Convention]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The [[California Supreme Court]] in the case of ''[[People v. Anderson]]'', (6 Cal.3d 628) invalidates the state's [[Capital punishment|death penalty]] and commutes the sentences of all [[death row]] inmates to life imprisonment.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[Space Shuttle Enterprise|Space Shuttle ''Enterprise'']] test vehicle is carried on its maiden "flight" on top of a [[Boeing 747]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The first [[Ironman Triathlon]] competition takes place on the island of [[Oahu]] and is won by [[Gordon Haller]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Snowfall|Snow]] falls in the [[Sahara Desert]] in southern [[Algeria]] for the only time in recorded history.
*[[1983]] &ndash; Thirteen people die and one is seriously injured in the [[Wah Mee massacre]] in [[Seattle, Washington]]. It is said to be the largest robbery-motivated mass-murder in U.S. history.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|IRA]] explodes bombs in the early morning at [[Paddington station]] and [[Victoria station (London)|Victoria station]] in London.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] agent [[Robert Hanssen]] is arrested for [[spying]] for the [[Soviet Union]]. He is ultimately convicted and sentenced to [[life imprisonment]].
*  2001   &ndash; Seven-time [[NASCAR]] [[Sprint Cup Series]] champion [[Dale Earnhardt]] [[Death of Dale Earnhardt|dies in an accident]] during the [[Daytona 500]].
*  2001   &ndash; [[Sampit conflict|Inter-ethnic violence]] between [[Dayak people|Dayaks]] and [[Madura Island|Madurese]] breaks out in [[Sampit]], [[Indonesia]], that will ultimately result in more than 500 deaths and 100,000 Madurese displaced from their homes.
*[[2003]] &ndash; Nearly 200 people die in the [[Daegu subway fire]] in South Korea.
*[[2004]] &ndash; Up to 295 people, including nearly 200 rescue workers, die near [[Neyshabur]] in [[Iran]] when a runaway freight [[train]] carrying [[sulfur]], [[petrol]] and [[fertilizer]] [[Nishapur train disaster|catches fire and explodes]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Terrorist bombs [[2007 Samjhauta Express bombings|explode]] on the [[Samjhauta Express]] in [[Panipat]], [[Haryana]], India, killing 68 people.
*[[2014]] &ndash; At least 76 people are killed and hundreds are injured in [[February 2014 Euromaidan riots|clashes]] between riot police and demonstrators in [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]].
